repnme.cdata!:
Moldova - Public Financial Management
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Financial
            Management (PFM) Technical Assistance Project for Moldova
            were as follows: outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory,
            risk to development outcome was substantial, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: it is essential that ministries of finance
            implementing complex information and communication
            technology (ICT) projects retain advisers with expertise in
            managing large and complex ICT systems implementation
            projects. Projects can be more effective if PFM reforms are
            not linked to the implementation of the financial management
            information system (FMIS). A realistic time frame for the
            design and implementation of a complex FMIS project is seven
            to eight years. Project extensions should be long enough to
            allow the stakeholders to bring about changes in project
            performance. The design of World Bank standard bidding
            documents for information technology (IT) projects should be
            reviewed to assess their suitability. Resistance to change
            should be anticipated and the project should retain
            consensus building and communications arrangements
            throughout implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Moldova - Public Financial Management
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The Ministry of Finance (MoF) requested
            an extension of the closing date for the Moldova Public
            Financial Management Technical Assistance Project (PFMTA)
            for twelve months, from December 31, 2012 to December 31,
            2013. This will allow for the completion of the Financial
            Management Information System (FMIS) and achievement of the
            Project Development Objective (PDO). The new budget
            classification, chart of accounts, internal audit practices
            supported by the project can only be fully implemented with
            the FMIS in place. The implementation of the FMIS will
            benefit the public financial management (PFM) system of the
            country and has major implications on the budget support
            provided by the World Bank, the European Union (EU) and
            other donors. The high-level commitment of the management of
            the MoF, as evidenced by appointment of the Deputy Minister
            as Project Manager in 2012 and improved project management
            practices, provides a basis for the successful completion of
            the FMIS in 2013. Given that all the efforts will be
            directed towards the implementation of the FMIS and that
            non-FMIS related objectives were achieved, the portion of
            the IDA credit not related to FMIS development will be
            cancelled as part of this restructuring.

Moldova - Public Financial
            Management Project : restructuring : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Field guide on soil bioengineering for
            slope stabilization in Timor-Leste

abstracts.cdata!:
Soil bioengineering is a useful and
            effective technology for slope stabilization and soil
            conservation. Soil bioengineering is defined as 'the
            use of living plant materials to construct structures that
            perform an engineering function'. The technology is
            simple, low cost, and effective, requires little to no
            maintenance, is environmentally friendly, and sustainable.
            Soil bioengineering structures used for slope stabilization
            include retaining walls, check dams and mechanical barriers
            for fixing loose soil on landslides and fill slopes. In
            addition to slope stabilization, soil bioengineering
            structures are also used to control gully and river bank
            erosion. Gullies commonly occur on landslides and fill
            slopes if treatment is not given in time and landslides are
            also triggered by undercutting from river and channel
            erosion. Soil bioengineering retaining walls are effective
            in stabilizing slips and small landslides. Necessary
            information about local tree and grass species suitable for
            soil bioengineering was collected during the visit to
            Timor?Leste, including establishing the most suitable season
            for conducting soil bioengineering activities.

docna.cdata!:
Field guide on soil bioengineering for slope
            stabilization in Timor-Leste

Field guide on soil

repnme.cdata!: Moldova - Promoting sustainable growth and competitiveness

abstracts.cdata!:
This report talks about the promoting
            sustainable growth and competitiveness in Moldova. Facing
            the need for a sustainable growth strategy, Moldova has been
            working with the International Development Association (IDA)
            to address its main development challenges through increased
            economic competitiveness, promotion of human development and
            social inclusion, and increased effectiveness of the public sector.

docna.cdata!: Moldova - Promoting sustainable growth and competitiveness

            growth and competitiveness
